Fairly sure I was just going straight west at 260 m/s.

Congratulations! I\'m also amused that subsonic speeds are enough to do this, assuming that Kerbin\'s speed-of-sound is about the same as Earth\'s.

Thanks to this thread, I researched on wikipedia and learned that the Earth\'s atmosphere is being dragged along at roughly 1.3 times the speed of sound by inertia and gravity (at the equator, less as latitude increases.) Interesting, a little scary, and something I should have already known from weather patterns.
